dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S1912 IS: To clarify that certain banking entities are not required to divest from collateralized debt obligations backed by trust preferred securities under the Volcker Rule.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Manchin (for himself and Mr. Wicker) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To clarify that certain banking entities are not required to divest from collateralized debt obligations backed by trust preferred securities under the Volcker Rule.

section.header: Volcker rule clarification relating to collateralized debt obligations backed by trust preferred securities

paragraph.text: Nothing in this section shall require or be construed to require a banking entity having total consolidated assets of less than $50,000,000,000 or an organization that is a mutual holding company to divest from any collateralized debt obligation issued before May 19, 2010, ifâ€”

subparagraph.text: the primary purpose for any such obligation was as a vehicle for trust preferred securities; and
the investment in any such obligation was made on or before December 10, 2013.
